column1: '''Richard C. West''' (August [[1944]]) is an awarded [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] scholar and the Serials and Technical Services Librarian at the [http://www.engr.wisc.edu/services/kfw/staff/west_richard.html University of Wisconsin-Madison]. When he was still a student
column2: he also started a [[Tolkien Societies|Tolkien Society]] there
column3: the [[University of Wisconsin Tolkien and Fantasy Society|University of Wisconsin Tolkien Society]]
column4: in September [[1966]]. He has also contributed to its yearly journal

column1: **"Tolkien in the Letters of C. S. Lewis"
**"The Interlace and Professor Tolkien: Medieval Narrative Technique in ''The Lord of the Rings''"
**"The Tolkienians: Some Introductory Reflections on Alan Garner
** "A Dose of Double Dactyls" (with various others)
**"Letters of C. S. Lewis to E. Vinaver"
**"The Interlace Structure of The Lord of the Rings" (published in Orcrist 1)
** "Túrin's ''Ofermod'': An Old English Theme in the Development of the Story of Túrin"
**"'And She Named Her Own Name': Being True To One's Word in Tolkien's Middle-earth"
* [[2006]]: ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien Encyclopedia: Scholarship and Critical Assessment]]''
* [[2011]]: [[Picturing Tolkien|''Picturing Tolkien: Essays on Peter Jackson's'' The Lord of the Rings ''Film Trilogy'']]
** "Neither the Shadow nor the Twilight: The Love Story of Aragorn and Arwen in Literature and Film"
*[[2014]]: ''[[Tolkien in the New Century|Tolkien in the New Century: Essays in Honor of Tom Shippey]]
**"'Lack of Counsel Not of Courage': J.R.R. Tolkien's Critique of the Heroic Ethos in ''The Children of Húrin''"

column2: Mythopoeic Scholarship Award for Inkling Studies
